results.title: U.S. Sweat
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Gorewitz describes U.S. Sweat as a ‘cathartic reaction to social and personal upheavals’, he transforms images of the familiar American landscape into a nightmarish, ghostly vision. Recording throughout the South and in New York, he amassed footage that reflects the American experience. Country roads, gravestones and small-town main streets seen from a car window gradually give way to an ominous vision — saturated by Gorewitz’s signature image-processing techniques and lurid, fluorescent colors — of an America dominated by industry and the military. Called a tour-de-force by The New York Times, this is a propulsive, kinetic work of rich visual and aural textures.

results.title: U.N. Kindergarten
results.brief_description: Deals with the kindergarten set up to cater for the children of United Nations officials in New York. Children of 25 nationalities work and play together amicably as a practical example of international cooperation.

results.title: U.N. in the classroom
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Julian Biggs and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: With minimum supervision from their teacher, seventh-grade school children conduct a model classroom assembly, patterned after a session of the United Nations, and debate an issue. The film demonstrates an original approach in helping children get to know the world they live in.

results.title: U.F.O's
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Knowlton, Lillian Schwartz and Bell Telephone Laboratories
results.brief_description: An imaginative experiment in film art, using computer graphics and synthesised music. Achieves a stroboscopic effect through motion, rhythm and form. Music by Emmanuel Ghent.

results.title: U-turn
results.creator_credit: Oliver Stone, Dan Halsted, Clayton Townsend, Clyde is Hungry Films, Illusion Entertainment Group and Phoenix Pictures
results.brief_description: Bobby Cooper (Sean Penn) is a former tennis pro, now a small time gambler on the run from some bookies who will do anything to get their money back. On his way to Las Vegas to pay his debt, he car breaks down in a small desert town. Whilst waiting for his car to be fixed by quirky mechanic Darrell (Billy Bob Thornton), Bobby meets and becomes attracted to Grace (Jennifer Lopez) who unbeknownst to him, is married to Jake (Nick Nolte), a much older and seemingly possessive man who is furious when he discovers them together. When Bobby is unable to pay for the repairs to his car and Jake offers to pay Bobby to kill his wife, he agrees, becoming involved in a situation far worse than anything he has ever imagined - when Grace makes him an offer he can’t refuse. The town characters creating havoc in Bobby’s world include a wisdom-spouting blind veteran (Jon Voight), Jenny, (Claire Danes) a troubled teenager trying to escape the confines of the town and her abusive boyfriend Toby N. Tucker (Joaquin Phoenix) and the Sheriff (Powers Boothe) trying to maintain order in the town, despite hiding a secret of his own. Also includes appearances by Laurie Metcalf and Liv Tyler. Based on the novel ‘Stray Dogs’ by John Ridley.

results.title: Tyrants will rise from my tomb
results.creator_credit: Clive Fleury and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Sweat of the sun, tears of the moon”.
The title of this episode is a quote from Simon Bolivar, the general who liberated South America from its Spanish conquerors over 150 years ago. Bolivar’s victory brought independence, but not necessarily freedom given the virtual epidemic of military dictatorships in South America since Bolivar. Writer and narrator, Jack Pizzey, visits two countries - Bolivia, named after Bolivar and Pinochet’s Chile - to discover why South Americans are prone to dictatorship and asks whether or not Bolivar’s nightmare of tyrants is fading.
